explanations.summary: Sympathetic CHOLINERGIC fibers are rare - most sympathetic fibers are adrenergic. Exception: skeletal muscle arterioles receive sympathetic cholinergic vasodilator fibers for anticipatory exercise vasodilation. Salivary glands use parasympathetic, not sympathetic cholinergic.

whyCorrect.d: Skeletal muscle arterioles uniquely receive sympathetic CHOLINERGIC vasodilator innervation. These fibers release ACh to cause vasodilation in anticipation of exercise.

whyIncorrect.a: Salivary gland vasodilation is PARASYMPATHETIC cholinergic (cranial nerves), not sympathetic cholinergic.
whyIncorrect.b: Cerebral vessels have minimal autonomic innervation - blood flow is mainly autoregulated.
whyIncorrect.c: Coronary vessels are controlled by metabolic factors. Sympathetic innervation is ADRENERGIC (beta-2).
whyIncorrect.e: External genitalia vasodilation is PARASYMPATHETIC (pelvic splanchnic nerves), not sympathetic cholinergic.

explanations.topicReference: Topic 20: Autonomic Control of Blood Vessels

explanations.summary: Sympathetic cholinergic vasodilator fibers innervate skeletal muscle arterioles - unique exception to adrenergic sympathetic rule. Causes anticipatory vasodilation before/during exercise.

whyCorrect.a: Skeletal muscle arterioles receive sympathetic CHOLINERGIC fibers that release ACh causing vasodilation. This is for anticipatory/exercise-related increase in muscle blood flow.

whyIncorrect.b: External genitalia use PARASYMPATHETIC cholinergic innervation from pelvic splanchnic nerves.
whyIncorrect.c: Salivary glands receive PARASYMPATHETIC cholinergic innervation from cranial nerves (VII, IX).
whyIncorrect.d: Cerebral vessels have minimal autonomic innervation - flow is metabolically/pressure autoregulated.
whyIncorrect.e: Coronary arteries are mainly metabolically controlled; sympathetic innervation is ADRENERGIC.

explanations.topicReference: Topic 20: Autonomic Control of Blood Vessels
